captions.text: Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro!

Ro: Welcome to another Nerdy Nummies! Today,
I have a special guest.
Kurt: What is up guys?

Ro: It’s my friend Kurt Hugo Schneider,
I’ll put his links down below, he

Ro: makes amazing music. And, we were just
hangin’ out, having pizza

Ro: and Kurt was on his way out, I said, hey,
want to film a Nerdy Nummies?

Kurt: So, here we are, what, what are we gonna
make today with all this stuff.

Ro: Um, I found a bunch of ingredients, and
the best recipe that I could

Ro: come up with is, today, we are going to
be making Harry Potter

Ro: Hedwig Owl cupcakes. Kurt: Nerd bird,
if you will. Ro: Nerd bird!

Ro: And they’re gonna be butter beer themed
so, yum, yum, yum, yum, yum!

Kurt: Awesome. Ro: Are you ready? Kurt: Uh,
yes!
Both: Let’s get started!

Ro: The things you will need, will be: 2 Cups
of flour, 1/2 a cup of dark

Ro: brown sugar, 1/2 a cup of regular sugar,
3 eggs, and 1/2 a cup of cream soda.

Kurt: You will also need 1 and 1/2 teaspoons
of baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon

Kurt: of salt and a 1/2 teaspoon of baking
soda. Along with some vanilla extract,

Kurt: some imitation butter flavor, a stick
of butter, a tray for your cupcakes

Kurt: with liners, and a blender, which can
also double as a massage device.

Ro: OK. Kurt: Low setting first. Ro: Oh my
gosh Kurt, don’t get my hair.

Ro: That feels really good actually, yeah
you can use these as a back massager.

Kurt: It would be really bad if it got your
hair.

Ro: The first thing that we’re gonna do
is we’re gonna mix our ingredients

Ro: together in two separate bowls, so Kurt’s
got the little bowl over here,

Ro: and he’s gonna mix together our dry
ingredients, we’ve got flour.

Kurt: Our salt, baking soda, baking powder.
Ro: And then just whisk it together.

Ro: Till it’s evenly combined. Once it’s
whisked we’re just gonna set it

Ro: off to the side and we’re gonna combine
a lot of our wet ingredients.

Kurt: OK. Ro: In the wet bowl you’re gonna
put in a stick of butter,

Ro: both of your sugars. Now you’re gonna
beat these together, I’m gonna use

Ro: this one, because I’m not sure the whisk
can just handle it. Oh my gosh!

Kurt: There is one very intense piece of brown
sugar in here. And the excess

Kurt: cream soda will be used for the, the
sweet taste of success.
Ro: Kurt loves cream soda.

Ro: Alright, now you’re gonna add your eggs,
one at a time. and then you’re gonna

Ro: mix them in after each time. Now you’re
gonna add 1 and 1/2 teaspoon of

Ro: vanilla. Kurt: 1 teaspoon of our butter
flavoring. Now you’re gonna alternate

Kurt: adding your dry ingredients, your cream
soda and your buttermilk until

Kurt: they’re all in there and mixed up.
Ro: Yeah, and guys I forgot to say that

Ro: we will need buttermilk. Kurt: So buttermilk.
Ro: Cause we did this on the fly.

Ro: Put in some dry ingredients. Kurt: Alright,
we could get some of those

Kurt: dry ingredients goin in. Ro: And I’ll
be mixing. Kurt: Sure. Ro: K

Ro: OK, buttermilk. Kurt: A little cream soda.
Ro: Cream soda.
Ro: Doo-doo-doo-doo-da-la-doo-doo-doo-doo

Ro: Now we’ve got our batter all mixed together,
you’re gonna get your cupcake

Ro: tray and you’re gonna scoop about 2
tablespoons of batter into each cupcake

Ro: tray. Once you’ve got your cupcake trays
filled, you are going to heat the oven

Ro; to 350 and then we’re gonna bake for
about 18 minutes. And while those

Ro: are baking, I’m gonna show you how to
make a butterscosch ganache… Wait…

Kurt: Butt.. Butterscotch Ganache. Ro: Butterscotch
Ganache sauce that we’re gonna

Ro: dip these in. Kurt: Sweet! Let’s do
it! Ro: It’s pretty good, so let’s
Ro: head over to the stove.

Ro: You’re gonna take a medium sized sauce
pan and fill it about an inch tall

Ro: with water, and then you’re gonna turn
on the heat. Kurt, do you want

Ro: to turn it on to about medium-high? Kurt:
I am ready for that!

Ro: Alright. Kurt: Alright, medium high. Ro:
Yep, and while the water heats up

Ro: you’re gonna take a glass bowl, put
it on top, something that’s heat safe.

Ro: And Kurt’s got 1 cup of heavy whipping
cream. And then we’re gonna

Ro: add one bag of butterscotch morsels, this
is 11 ounces.

Ro: Now just slowly stir the ingredients over
the heat until everything is
Ro: melted and well combined.

Kurt: Here is our ganache, we let it cool
off a little bit. So, what are we

Kurt: doing next Ro? Ro: Next, our cupcakes
just came out of the oven,

Ro: give them a little bit of time to cool,
they can still be warm,

Ro: that’s fine. But, we are gonna dip our
cupcakes into the ganache so that they

Ro: just have a little bit of extra flavoring.
It’s gonna taste really good!

Ro: A little bit of layered flavor. Kurt:
Nice. Ro: When you bite into these!

Ro: Alright, so here’s a cupcake, I’m
gonna show you how to do this.

Ro: When I dip, you dip… We dip! Kurt: Awesome!
Ro: That’s a song, it’s a
Ro: really old song…

Ro: Are you ready? Just try to dip it right
until the liner.

Kurt: I’m just trying to follow you because
I really don’t want to mess up!

Ro: And, ah, let it drip off, let the excess
drip off.

Ro: Once you’ve dipped your cupcakes you’re
just gonna let them sit for about

Ro: 5 minutes to let the ganache set. And
then it’s my favorite part!
Ro: Time to decorate!

Kurt: And for that, you’re gonna need some
vanilla frosting and chocolate

Kurt: frosting and also, we’ve got some
Oreos, which we already took off

Kurt: one half of the side. They’re mini
Oreos. Ro: Mmmhmm!

Kurt: Rosanna sized Oreos, some sliced almonds,
and also some Reese’s Pieces.

Ro: Yep! And first thing that you’re gonna
do is take your vanilla icing,

Ro: we’ve got 2 bags, are you ready for
this?
Kurt: Schoo! Both: Schoooom, schoooom!

Ro: Take your vanilla frosting and you’re
just gonna frost the top of the cupcake.

Ro: I like to start on the outside and then
go all the way around.

Ro: And then, I’m just gonna take a little
spatula, and smooth it out.

Ro: Are you ready to decorate now that these
cupcakes are frrrrrosted?
Kurt: Mmmmm, why yes Rosanna, mmmmm.

Ro: Well, um, I ran out of toothpicks, so
I just had these little mustache

Ro: toothpicks leftover. Kurt: Which is amazing!
Ro: Mmmhmm, they’re very fun!

Ro: What do you think? Kurt: I feel like I
should rob a train while I’m

Kurt: wearing this mustache! Ro: Aw, yeah,
schee, you’re never gonna catch me

Ro: coppers, yeah schee! Kurt: Aw, yes, you’ve
foiled my plans once again!
Kurt: For the last time!

Ro: And the first thing we’re gonna do is
put on their eyeballs. So you’re

Ro: gonna take 2 of the mini Oreos, and you’re
gonna stick a brown

Ro: Reese’s Pieces on top, then you’re
just gonna stick them on top of the

Ro: cupcake and you’re gonna leave a little
bit of space in between.

Ro: Now we’ve got all the little owl eyeballs
on there, you’re gonna take

Ro: an orange Reese’s Pieces for his nose
and put it right in the middle.

Ro: You’re gonna put it this way, so that
it’s vertical.

Ro: Now that you’ve got the noses on, you’re
gonna take the almonds and

Ro: you’re gonna put 3 on the top on each
side for the little feathers and then
Ro: 3 on the bottom.

Ro: Final decoration step, you’re gonna
take your chocolate icing, and

Ro: I put a number 1 tip at the end so we
have more control and we’re just gonna
Ro: make some little feathers.

Kurt: And you’re gonna do that to owl of
them… Ro: He-hee-hee-hee!

Kurt: If I were to name this guy, he’d be…
Owl-burt!

Ro: What would be their favorite band? Kurt:
The Who! Ro: Tee-hee-hee-hee!
Both: Ta-da!

Ro: Here are the Hedwig Butterbeer Cupcakes
that we made, they smell so good!

Ro: And, Kurt has a favorite! Kurt: This one
definitely, it’s, it’s the eyes!

Kurt: Ya know? It’s all in the eyes, he
just looks so cute!

Ro: I like this one, he’s a little derpy!
Look at that! Depending on how
Ro: you put the eyes on there, they just have such different personalities.

Kurt: Yeah, some of them came our derpy, but
they’re still cute!

Ro: Yeah, aw! Thanks you guys for watching,
I know this was a random video.

Ro: Big thank you to Kurt for being here.
Kurt: Thank you for having me!

Ro: So random. Kurt: Again! Ro: This was so
fun! Alright, I will put his

Ro: links down below, so go check him out,
He’s a pretty cool guy!

Ro: And, I’ll put lots of pictures of our
little owls on Facebook, Tumblr,

Ro: Twitter and Instagram. And if you guys
make these, please send me photos,

Ro: I get a big kick out of seeing your baking
creations, tweet them to us!
Ro: Alright thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
